body:
It's certainly what the previous comment was basically saying, but I think my brain must not have been functioning right. I blame #578. Sorry.

So, the right way to fix this is to add `Utils.jsm` in the support-files instruction of the relevant tests (or maybe just for `[DEFAULT]`) in the `browser.ini` manifest.

Then in the tests (or in a head.js file for that test dir), you can use something like this (untested!):

```js
Cu.import(getRootDirectory(gTestPath) + "Utils.jsm");
```

I'm a bit confused because I think in my earlier comment I thought we were using this file from xpcshell tests, too, but I don't see this happening in my current m-c tree. Am I missing something?
